summary: Converts a FASTQ file to an unaligned BAM or SAM file.

arguments.summary: Allow (and ignore) empty lines
arguments.name: --ALLOW_AND_IGNORE_EMPTY_LINES

arguments.summary: Comment(s) to include in the merged output file's header.
arguments.name: --COMMENT

arguments.summary: Compression level for all compressed files created (e.g. BAM and GELI).
arguments.name: --COMPRESSION_LEVEL

arguments.summary: Whether to create a BAM index when writing a coordinate-sorted BAM file.
arguments.name: --CREATE_INDEX

arguments.summary: Whether to create an MD5 digest for any BAM or FASTQ files created.
arguments.name: --CREATE_MD5_FILE

arguments.summary: Inserted into the read group header
arguments.name: --DESCRIPTION

arguments.summary: Input fastq file (optionally gzipped) for single end data, or first read in paired end data.
arguments.name: --FASTQ

arguments.summary: Input fastq file (optionally gzipped) for the second read of paired end data.
arguments.name: --FASTQ2

arguments.summary: Google Genomics API client_secrets.json file path.
arguments.name: --GA4GH_CLIENT_SECRETS

arguments.summary: The library name to place into the LB attribute in the read group header
arguments.name: --LIBRARY_NAME

arguments.summary: Maximum quality allowed in the input fastq.  An exception will be thrown if a quality is greater than this value.
arguments.name: --MAX_Q

arguments.summary: When writing SAM files that need to be sorted, this will specify the number of records stored in RAM before spilling to disk. Increasing this number reduces the number of file handles needed to sort a SAM file, and increases the amount of RAM needed.
arguments.name: --MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM

arguments.summary: Minimum quality allowed in the input fastq.  An exception will be thrown if a quality is less than this value.
arguments.name: --MIN_Q

arguments.summary: Output SAM/BAM file.
arguments.name: --OUTPUT

arguments.summary: The platform type (e.g. illumina, solid) to insert into the read group header
arguments.name: --PLATFORM

arguments.summary: Platform model to insert into the group header (free-form text providing further details of the platform/technology used)
arguments.name: --PLATFORM_MODEL

arguments.summary: The platform unit (often run_barcode.lane) to insert into the read group header
arguments.name: --PLATFORM_UNIT

arguments.summary: Predicted median insert size, to insert into the read group header
arguments.name: --PREDICTED_INSERT_SIZE

arguments.summary: Program group to insert into the read group header.
arguments.name: --PROGRAM_GROUP

arguments.summary: A value describing how the quality values are encoded in the input FASTQ file.  Either Solexa (phred scaling + 66), Illumina (phred scaling + 64) or Standard (phred scaling + 33).  If this value is not specified, the quality format will be detected automatically.
arguments.name: --QUALITY_FORMAT

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: Read group name
arguments.name: --READ_GROUP_NAME

arguments.summary: Reference sequence file.
arguments.name: --REFERENCE_SEQUENCE

arguments.summary: Date the run was produced, to insert into the read group header
arguments.name: --RUN_DATE

arguments.summary: Sample name to insert into the read group header
arguments.name: --SAMPLE_NAME

arguments.summary: The sequencing center from which the data originated
arguments.name: --SEQUENCING_CENTER

arguments.summary: The sort order for the output sam/bam file.
arguments.name: --SORT_ORDER

arguments.summary: Deprecated (No longer used). If true and this is an unpaired fastq any occurrence of '/1' or '/2' will be removed from the end of a read name.
arguments.name: --STRIP_UNPAIRED_MATE_NUMBER

arguments.summary: One or more directories with space available to be used by this program for temporary storage of working files
arguments.name: --TMP_DIR

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Deflater instead of the Intel Deflater for writing compressed output
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_DEFLATER

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Inflater instead of the Intel Inflater for reading compressed input
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_INFLATER

arguments.summary: Use sequential fastq files with the suffix <prefix>_###.fastq or <prefix>_###.fastq.gz
arguments.name: --USE_SEQUENTIAL_FASTQS

arguments.summary: Validation stringency for all SAM files read by this program.  Setting stringency to SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.
arguments.name: --VALIDATION_STRINGENCY

arguments.summary: Control verbosity of logging.
arguments.name: --VERBOSITY

description: Converts a fastq file to an unaligned BAM/SAM format. See MAQ FastQ specification for details. Three fastq versions are supported: FastqSanger, FastqSolexa and FastqIllumina. Input files can be in GZip format (end in .gz).
name: FastqToSam
